question: What year was Martin Luther King Jr. assassinated?
note: 1968: He was killed in Memphis, Tenn., where he had gone to support a strike by sanitation workers.

question: Where did Rosa Parks become famous?
note: On a bus in Montgomery, Alabama. Her arrest Dec. 1 lead to a yearlong boycott aimed to desegregate the bus system.

question: Which president signed the first major civil rights act of this century?
note: Lyndon B. Johnson. He signed the Civil Rights Act of 1964 on July 2 that year.

question: Which president signed the law creating the Martin Luther King holiday?
note: Ronald Reagan. It was in November 1983, more than 15 years after King was killed.

question: What was the name of King's first book?
note: Stride Toward Freedom. He was only 29 years old when it was published.

question: Where was the tactic of the sit-in protest first used?
note: At a Woolworth's lunch counter in Greensboro, North Carolina. The 1960 protest was one of the key moments in the civil-rights movement.

question: Where did King deliver his "I Have a Dream" speech?
note: At the Lincoln Memorial. He addressed a quarter-million people who turned out for the 1963 March on Washington.

question: Who is the protagonist of the Charles Johnson novel, Dreamer?
note: A bodyguard in Chicago. In the novel, this man was picked because of his resemblance to King.

question: What foreign figure has King been compared to?
note: Mohandas Gandhi. King admired Gandhi greatly, and traveled to India in 1959.

question: What year was the Martin Luther King national holiday first observed?
note: 1986. The first legislation for the holiday had been proposed almost 18 years earlier.

question: What black leader was killed five years before King's assassination?
note: Medgar Evers. The NAACP leader was murdered June 12, 1963.

question: Why was King arrested in 1956?
note: Driving too fast. (He was driving 30 mph in a 25 mph zone.) That same year, in the very early days of the civil-rights movement, his house was bombed.
